@graph.title: Genes on the menu : facts for knowledge based decisions ; with 20 tables ; [with CD-ROM]
@graph.abstract: Only little more than a decade ago the term "genetic engineering" was hardly known outside research laboratories. Today it regularly makes headlines in the news. Supporters and opponents as well tell us that it will change our lives more than any other technological advance. This book delivers the state-of-the-art facts in order to empower the public to make knowledge-based decisions about plant biotechnology and GM crops and GM food, in particular. It discusses the hot topics of the present debate in a neutral manner and will function as a personal reference book for the interested public, for decision maker, and manager of consumer organisations. The enclosed CD-ROM containing the film "Genes on the Menue" is intended to be used as a primer by the reader. TOC:Contents: 0. GMO issues today- an introduction 1.
